title: Can't delete calendar entries from external sources
content:

However, after the even passes, I cannot stop reminders, even past the date of the event. And I cannot delete the event from my calendar.

My calendar is hosted on Google. By going directly into my Google account, I can delete the event, just not in Thunderbird.

title: Change new-message-icon
content:
Is there a way to revert the new-message-icon back to the pre-supernova-version? The new icon is highly unattractive.

Thankfully I already found a way to revert the application icon back to normal by replacing messengerWindow.ico inside \chrome\icons\default, but the new-message-icon is unaffected by that.

I'm also happy to mess with omni.ja for this purpose. Thought I had found a promising file by name with new-mail-alert.png inside omni.ja\chrome\classic\skin\classic\messenger\icons\ but it did not change anything, despite clearing startup cache.

Do I really have to mess with the .exe resources to get the old icon back?

(Yes, I could reinstall the old version, but that is not a sustainable way since it will accumulate security flaws over time, eventually forcing me back to this question anyway).

title: Signature image not showing up
content:
I followed the instruction to "attach the signature from a file instead" but when people reply the image/logo is not there, see attached image. I figured the image is there but just doesn't show up in replies, but someone just tole me it's not showing up on their end. What I don't understand is that when I send an email to my gmail, it's there. I just sent a test to my proton email account and viewed it from a different computer and it was there, plus when I replied it showed up on my end. So I just don't understand why other people don't see it, but I do, even in a different email viewer in a different email account on a different computer, but no one else sees it.

When I looked at the code generated when I used the "compose" to create the sig it shows this: 

   <font style="font-size: 13pt" </pre> 

 I replaced that with this: 
   <font style="font-size: 13pt" face="Arial">
 
 
That seems to work, but what I want is to have the image directly attached to the email so it doesn't have to download if from my server when they get an email. The instruction I keep finding are not clear on how to do this or on what img moz-do-not-send="false" really means. 
can someone help please? </font>

title: Options to manually download single email account and exclude accounts from "Get Messages" download disappeared
content: There used to be a narrow add-on button on the right side of the "Get Messages" button which displayed a dropdown list of all my email accounts when clicked, so I could select a single account from which to manually download messages. There also used to be a setting to exclude selected accounts from downloading when I clicked the "Get Messages" button. Both of these features disappeared with the Supernova update. I am not a big fan of "updates" that remove useful features I have relied on for years. Please tell me this functionality will be restored in the near future, or point me to the settings to re-enable it.

title: Instalação por WinGet reporta versão beta
content: Ao instalar o Thunderbird através do winget no Windows, o aplicativo fica registrado como Mozilla.Thunderbird.Beta. Isso causa problema se o usuário utiliza o winget para atualizar os pacotes uma vez que o winget sempre apresentará que existe uma nova versão disponível visto que a versão beta está sempre à frente. Isso não causa problema no atualizador padrão do Thunderbird. Acredito que o id Mozilla.Thunderbird deveria estar separado do id Mozilla.Thunderbird.Beta no winget. Grato.

title: Gmail + Thunderbird + Focus bug - causes accidental deletion (possibly ever since Supernova was launched)
content:
Let me give a minimal example to create a scenario.

Please note that I mostly use Keyboard shortcuts, which play important part in this bug.

So let us say, I have only two messages in Gmail.

  1. Subject: This is new but unimportant message
  2. Subject: This is old and important message

Now thunderbird synced Inbox as well as All Mail folder of Gmail. And both the folders have same mails.

So: Inbox shows 1/2 (one unread, total 2 messages) All mail also shows 1/2 (one unread, total 2 messages)

As I said earlier, I mostly use Keyboard shortcuts.

  1. I open Inbox.
  2. And read first message (with subject: This is new but unimportant message).
  3. I find unimportant. So I press 'Del' key to delete that message
  4. Then I immediately press 'n' to move to next unread message
  5. Now thunderbird takes me to All Mail folder of GMail
  6. Since All Mail still does not know that 1st email was deleted from Inbox folder, it shows me same email again in All Mail folder.
  7. So I press 'Del' key to delete that message (which was already deleted from Inbox but not synced with All mail)
  8. But by the time I press 'Del' key the thunderbird synced the All Mail folder, and on its own deleted the first message and focus was dropped on 2nd email.
  9. Now since focus was dropped on 2nd (important) email while I was pressing the Del key, instead of deleting first unimportant email, I accidentally deleted 2nd important email without realizing what happened. (Important message is gone without me realizing)
  10. This issue was not there earlier (I believe before Supernova). Earlier focus did not fall on 2nd email automatically but thunderbird completely de-focused the pane. So even if I press Del key it would not delete anything.

I have had many instances of important email going to Trash because of this newly introduced bug. Noticing mostly after Supernova was introduced.

In above example there were just 2 emails, so one would immediately notice that How come all emails vanished when I just deleted one email.

But in reality I have hundreds of new messages and would not realize that Del key was pressed on an important email because thunderbird changed the focus.

Please look in to the bug and resolve

Thank you
